steps: Navigate to Settings > Attendance > Overtime Policy
Configure extra hours request permissions for employees
Select hourly rate type (Single or Custom)
Select salary component (Basic Salary or Basic Salary + Allowances)
Define days calculation method (default is Custom Days - 30 days)
Set default working hours (default is 8 hours)
Select employees to assign to the policy
what_to_do.expected_outcome: A new overtime policy is created and assigned to selected employees
System will compensate all hours between check-in and check-out at the fixed hourly rate

what_to_do.task: Assign overtime to employees in advance
steps: Choose compensation type (payroll or time off)
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Overtime is scheduled for selected employees who can accept or reject the request

what_to_do.task: View scheduled overtime hours as an employee
steps: Navigate to Attendance > Time & Pay Adjustments
Review extra hours details including manager's name and comments
Accept or reject the scheduled extra hours
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Employee can view and respond to overtime requests

what_to_do.task: Bulk approve overtime requests as a manager
steps: Log in as a Line Manager
Go to Time and Pay Adjustment section
Use bulk actions to select multiple overtime requests
Click 'Approve' to process all selected requests at once
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Multiple overtime requests are approved simultaneously

what_to_watch_out_for.known_issue: Overtime calculation with break time inclusion flag
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: When configuring work timing, either set work timing to include the full hours (e.g., 9 hours with break inclusion TRUE), or enable break inclusion flag for existing schedule. Test different scenarios in a demo account before applying to production.

what_to_watch_out_for.known_issue: Limited customization of allowance components for overtime calculation
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: The system currently only supports 'Basic Salary' or 'Basic Salary + All Allowances' options. For selective allowance inclusion, manual adjustments to overtime payments may be required.
The formula display may lack visual brackets, but calculations follow the correct order of operations. Verify actual calculation results rather than relying solely on the formula display.

what_to_watch_out_for.known_issue: Weekend overtime calculation for shift employees
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Be aware that all hours worked on weekends count as overtime when an employee is part of a Days in Lieu policy. Changes to work week configuration can affect how the system identifies weekends and calculates overtime.
